qZ3iXMXHgbt6L-gKrqJ1yA.text: Great freshly made drinks and an awesome happy hour beers on tap for days service can be slow and make sure to asked for double ketchup they tend to be stingy love music and complementary valet $$ prince range but staff is fun (and good looking) easy going crowed of all ages games such as ping pig corn hole darts as well as an outside  bar my staple go to   Personal favorites are the grilled cheese sliders pretzel fondue and the cheddar perogies a great snack are the Brussels sprouts check this place out

tfdGBWSVXxMWgULoZNHe2A.text: Aside from feeling like a carbon copy clone whenever I eat here, the food is good and it has a mix of casual and professional. In that aspect it is definitely unique.

yUJXZbDmiYlDNxrbITr8xg.text: Food's all good.  Hard to find a spot at the giant bar.  Charred Brussels sprouts were yummy.

8-PjsFBgRx6w4a3fIEvhww.text: Very chill modern place, the atmosphere is great and friendly. Good variety of apps and some of the best burgers!

-BnapsPEeu9beg5vSZiEDA.text: I must say that I have been here before for dinner then games and LOVED it. This time however, we came just to play games.   First off, all of the bags boards were occupied so we decided to attempt shuffle board...well there was only one set of weights and they were apparently "checked" out to someone and there WEREN'T even playing so we were a little pissed that they didn't have an extra set ... we will talk bout extra sets in a minute. Then we asked about playing beer pong at an open table they said they don't do that there so we went and got paddles to play actual ping pong. It was hard as hell because you could barely see the ball whizzing at you with the dim lighting...fail. Last, once we finally saw an empty/ not used board for bags, I went and checked one set of bags out. I even had all of our bags set up and ready to play  when my friend got back from getting us more drinks...and they had checked another set of bags out to someone right after me and they tried to play 'teams' with the four of us...that made us pretty aggravated because WHY in the HELL would you check out more bags than you have boards to play on. Makes NO Sense.   Overall, I used to recommend this place to people asking about something fun to do in Tempe but I don't think I can do that anymore.

wHGwxJHbh6CvtI4MfBdXgA.text: This place is very eccentric. The atmosphere is very cool and upbeat. The staff I personally dealt with were nice and friendly. The food was good and the drinks were good as well. It was a place to go to have a great time with friends. They have plenty of seating, though we could not understand why there wasn't any type of fan or cooling mechanism on the side we were on near the near the gaming area. It would have been great aside from that. Living in Az there should be something in place for cooling the customers during the summer. I would definitely go back but will make sure to make a reservation ahead of time to sit inside where the air is.

AYGMIkqsTAJeVwtAn0KfUQ.text: Wonderful food and excellent service! I had the roasted salmon and my husband had the shaved prime rib.

BbO6_DPMyNebet51Hr8d7w.text: Ate here cuz I thought the name was cool. Got the ribs and I was floored by how damn good they were. Get them you will thank me!

IrpwikFX_KfKMDMpYSUrhw.text: Service is a huge problem. These young people are untrained. The server came and took our order.. drinks came ...then nothing. Then part of our entrees, then the rest of the entrees and then the appetizer ( each was delivered by different staff and we needed to advise that our order was incomplete). Then the original server came with the bill , I stated I would like to have coffee.. she discouraged  us ".. we just have regular coffee"! The drinks were good, the food was okay but the service was abysmal. There are many choices in Tempe you should not have to settle for mediocre.

7cuD2nHeAVcCjctZTOu4mw.text: This place is amazing!!!! Just a relaxing vibe. Have some great food and unwind on play ping pong or cornhole.   Ordered the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy with a biscuit. It was delicious!!!!Best Mashed Potatoes and gravy ever!!!! Don't tell my wife I said that. Chicken was too die for so juicy and crunchy!!!

nRB_W2T2TfU_Wn8KTzx7pg.text: The food is perfect!  The name of the restaurant may depict that the food wouldn't be good but wow! It was delicious!  They need to open a Culinary school. . Glad our hotel recommended this place.

KlGPtUJYHg0NSLyV1UQbYQ.text: My first experience here and it was amazing. We came on a Sunday afternoon so it wasn't packed and there was plenty of parking.  We were seated immediately and our server was quick to get drinks and an appetizer started. The $5 pretzels and fondue appetizer was delicious, probably the best I've ever had.  Then I got the fried chicken and it was great as well. Overall it was a great experience and the restaurant atmosphere was great. I will definitely be back again.

Zqza0t08GpgaBmbYYoq_8Q.text: Culinary Dropout has great food, a modern atmosphere, and trendy style. Unfortunately, you should not come here if you do not eat meat. They offer very little options and when asked what non-meat meals they can offer and everything has to be altered. Message to your management: vegetarians and Vegas do not like to alter meals, in order to make it fit their diet. This place would be MUCH better, if they had a more diverse menu.

XFx_w_hZYPm_-b8M2x31ww.text: Just fun all round. Took my grandma here and the entire hipster staff treated her like a queen. Fun atmosphere (bags, fire pits, stage) and equally solid food. Pretzels, deviled eggs, brussel sprouts, beet salad, burger all executed on point. Always a good excuse to dine here.

d6lgbak8g5FVURjVHi0QQg.text: Fun place, love the outdoor bean bag toss options.  The food, no bueno however.

UU3gq3WY_o6sSOQfDRLVKA.text: Their fried chicken is on point, go get some! Their desserts are also awesome!  I've been here several times and the service has always been great. I also like the laid-back but clean atmosphere. Like I said... try their fried chicken. You'll love it.

LBq-noKQ7XK0qBNwdS2NAA.text: Had the fish and chips and it was amazing. Get a side of their home made ranch full of herbals and seasoning.

EihzkOoMOji7FYQTQ60mXg.text: Good food, happy hour starts too early and ends at 5 PM but understandavle due to it's location in downtown Tempe.

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Happy Hour time

ArWdqvYU6ZbfYNC7rxscHA.text: Great service! Very cute for graduations and birthday parties. I love the interior design of the restaurant.

kYF55StkVmOYiFd_bIf0Aw.text: Had to give this place a try based on the concept and reviews.  Great place to dine and play with friends but done expect to have a quiet conversation over your meal. The atmosphere is big and loud with live music in the evenings.  The food had exceptional moments and even those dishes that missed exceptional where just off the edge.   The menu is creative if a bit limited and exceptionally fresh. Build your own Antipasti is a nice way to start and if you get there early order the Korean rib cap which is a favorite but runs out early.  Come to have fun, enjoy the loud atmosphere, people watch, corn hole and have a very good food and beverage along the way.

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Butternut Squash soup with jalapeño creme fraiche
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Build your own Antipasti.  Great way to start
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Stop by and watch the chefs at work.  Impressive is a small space

qtfDXLhGUyt1u8RCi-ttgw.text: This place is great. Big enough that it's not over crowded, and lots of activities. I love the theme and the food is good too!  I'd like to see one in the San Tan area.

BDTuDgTYGFX2Bky5P7RPUQ.text: Absolutely love coming here. Food is always great and the staff is always friendly.   The only reason why I'm docking a star is because last time we went, my boyfriend had an allergic reaction to some biscuits with his meal that did not supposed to have nuts in it. I assume the tray they were baked on was used for their desserts as well. I hope it was just a one time thing, as we've always had attentive servers at CD when it comes to our allergy requests and questions.

h25cIqXJZJmLe8rPkYMj8A.text: Came here for a friends birthday.... This place is pretty cool... Pricey but cool.  I just love the set up and the food was delicious!  We were stationed in the middle area in between the main dining room and the area where they amhad ping pong and corn holes. There was a big group of us in the couches and chairs.  That night was freezing and the outside heaters kept us warm... I just wish they had a bigger area to eat out food because our table had a bonfire type thing in the middle and my fave felt like it was melting when I was eating my food lol.  I got the chicken sandwich and it was sooooo good! I was very happy with it... And my friend got the ravioli... She let me try some of it and I wanna go back and order some for myself! The PaB buger was delicious too!  I was very happy with the food and the atmosphere...plus our server was very good at keeping track of all our orders throughout the night :)  Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States

KCtXirDYj6ZRBra2Z6otHA.text: let me start off by saying this has NOTHING to do with our server! she did a good job; this is more or less about the food. i don't know if it was an off-day in the kitchen, but everything came out lukewarm. my favorite salad, the gorgonzola chicken, had no dressing on it, and the chicken and gorgonzola were totally stuck together in giant mounds underneath the greens. i asked for the proper dressing and got the wrong kind, so it ended up being wasted.   i've been in the industry for 5 years now and i get it - things happen, but i used to rave about this place for lunch and dinner to everyone that visits tempe. not sure if i'll be returning after this.

pl6IIvNGR07mdupsikRF-Q.text: I arrived around 5 and headed to the bar. It was already starting to get packed so I was lucky to grab a seat. The bartender was attentive despite being swamped, which I really appreciated. I ordered some variant of a mule, which was very tasty.   After the rest of my party arrived we were quickly sat. Our server was highly attentive the whole night. We never had an empty glass or plate for long. We had the bbq pork nachos and pretzel roll fondue. The fondue was great, who doesn't love melted cheese? And the pretzel rolls were surprisingly not dry and delicious. The nachos used real cheese but were already cold by the time they arrived to our table.  I ordered the ribs and they were decent. The meat was cooked well, not fall off the bone but very tender, but the sauce was a little overpowering.   Overall a good experience for a trendy night out.

NXzEhRniAL25mhT23spQNw.text: Horrible management.  Good idea having empty kegs near your photo booth area and then kicking out people's designated driver out of the bar when one gets picked up and put down for a photo at your restaurants photo booth.  Spoke to the manager an he could care less.  Last time we will come here.  Idiots.

adVijscviBEFVRKZnAxAQA.text: I love the pretzels and cheese! Fun environment for any group of people, I've seen business people, 20 somethings, and families all enjoying the food and service. Love sitting at the bar!

qU7SE3JySyS1cIE4ysUagg.text: Great places for large parties, food is always a solid 9. The big game area is fun for all ages after dinner or while you wait!

AC95vhPQZYJHQwyuJUnbBQ.text: The service was extremely slow because of the bar and the kitchen.  The waiter seemed like he was in a fog.  We sat for 10 minutes waiting for water (and had to ask for it), 20 minutes for drinks and 45 minutes for our food.  When the food finally came, there was very little of it for the cost. We asked for the manager's help...she disappeared.  I will not come back here again!

UQimN0M5kB0lQfgPbBFa2w.text: Food is fantastic! Especially the pork nachos. Service is usually pretty great too. Their drinks are ridiculously expensive though. A martini like drink is served in a small champagne glass used for toasts at weddings. We'll go back and order cans of beer though.

or6svcgMyx4o1clOxbibAw.text: Good food, terrible service Ordered appetizers that never arrived. Offered free desert and waited 30+ minutes and still waiting, prefer the check so we can leave. Vodka gimlet was not made with Rose lime juice

OIqWALttsIDVC2UrSAFLtg.text: In my opinion it is overpriced and the service is pretty slow! I wish they had more "regular" beers to choose from. It's a cool place to go play corn hole and ping pong but other than that I don't really go out of my way to go there for fun or to hang out.   Definitely would not go here during the hot months, the open concept bar and patio Is cool but if you want to be comfortable and not too hot I highly recommend skipping this place until the winter months and early spring!

_TiJM05_wbHEW00i5Y-ACg.text: It has a very creative name, and it makes you wonder what is behind the name. We went into this location after a long flight from Miami, so i was hungry and wanted good food. I received amazing food! The waitress was extremely friendly and helpful in guiding us through the menu and different beer selections. The burger was outstanding and the pretzels were to die for. I however recommend that you skip the corn bread it was not to my liking. I can not wait to visit Arizona again and go back to this location.

TtWsWxrX35P9K2__NqdSHA.text: Great menu so much unique stuff. I have been here 5 or 6 times now and never have had a bad dish..everything has been perfect from the steamed mussels to the fried chicken (one of my personal favorites) tonight I had the grilled cheese slides. They were done to perfection. Crispy outside and a warn gooey center. Still have no idea how that kept the tomato crisp through cooking. The live music was also phenomenal! Would have give this 5 stars but the service was just not stellar slightly long waits with empty drinks and to take orders but I will be coming again!

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. #vices

qrNfLgATSLuWa7f2oPbVPg.text: The only thing I didn't like about this place was that there were flies everywhere on the patio. I could barely keep them out of my drink and food. If it weren't for that it would've gotten a much higher rating because the service is great and the food was nice.

FBLKCUSrnf3OvCRUE8Mj5w.text: The food was good, would not order the ribs, the meat was tough, did not fall of the bone.  The fried chicken was tasty along with the chopped salad.  When it is hot out stay away from sitting by the door.  The flies were bad, asked to close the front door, they did for 5 minutes then they opened it back up and the flies were back!

tuQdc_rLqC5ui6e52O292Q.text: Found this place based on other yelp reviews. I mean, how else do you find restaurants in a new area? We were here at lunchtime and this place was hopping. No wait though and we were seated quickly. Hubby and I shared some pretzel bites for an appetizer. Absolutely delicious and the cheese fondue dip was excellent. We shared a chicken pesto club with fries and it was delicious. Super cool atmosphere and we definitely want to return on an evening when there is live music on the patio.

fAXI5gcwNW8TtC4OjNytSg.text: I came here for an anniversary dinner with my girlfriend. This place had a very nice atmosphere for hanging out with friends. It is definitely meant for the young adult crowd. We were seated in the large barn at a table for two. The menu was pretty pricey for our standards. We ordered the favorites, fried chicken and ribs, to share between us. The food took a bit to come out but they were indeed delicious. Unfortunately, the high price of food and drinks keeps us from coming back too often. Overall, we had a great experience and would one day come back.

-wJQfI0vVxadKnj448Nj1A.text: Nice venue for all walks of life. Great food. Excellent service. The El Matador is so refreshing.

ZoYAvN4amNKor_8OwaQuOg.text: 4 stars for food, 3 for the fact it took 30 min to get it even though this massive place wasn't that busy.  Turkey pastrami was delish.   I would definitely come back.  Looks like a fun place to hang out and throw a few bags and beers back!

c_LKhtAprPUVD9KbXXJxYA.text: We stopped in at about 7pm Sunday night. We sat in the outside patio area, great ambiance and lighting. The menu was interesting with something for all tastes. We had a group of five and meals included fried chicken, avocado toast and pretzel fondue, all were excellent. Service was fast and friendly.

jrBKAZz3uBnVVSy9PCGiww.text: Everything I heard about this place is True. Excellent food, service and atmosphere. Will be back soon ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States

VNFYsOIp1xFb1UDhdIliGg.text: Every time I tell someone I ate at Culinary Dropout, they give me the same blank stare. If you could see the puzzled look on their face, you'd know they are trying to resolve this oxymoron.  Last week, I met a business colleague for lunch at the Tempe location. My previous visits here were around happy hour and dinner. Lunch time is busier than I expected, so I'm glad we arrived early. It was a gorgeous day sandwiched between the recent rain storms, so we were happy to sit on the patio.  Speaking of sandwiches, I selected an excellent salad! I'm a big fan of seared Ahi Tuna. Who knew how good it could be on a simple chopped salad? And it's even better when paired with cashews, avocado, and sesame seeds with an Asian dressing. The portion of the salad and the Tuna were both very generous. This was a New Year's resolution kind of meal, but I'd be happy to enjoy a salad like this all year long.  The vibe at mid-day is unusual. Having seen this restaurant/bar/lounge/game room in full swing in the evening, lunch feels like the calm before the storm. To be more specific, this storm has a unique atmosphere, excellent service, a laid back attitude, great food and drinks, and lots of fun activities on the patio.  Culinary Dropout is a just a hop, skip and an illegal U-turn off of Mill Ave. Stop standing there with that look on your face and check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Quite simply, the best salad I&#39;ve ever had!

9c31YNoiMf4yugZuZX-SdA.text: I went here with my fiance and his family. We waited about 40mjn for a table which is fine.. but they had originally stated it would be about 15min and only seated us in a rush when we were about to walk out the door because we both had to be up at 4am the next morning! We were happy with our food but the whole experience just wasn't up to par with how expensive the food was. Maybe it's worth it if you are going here to drink the night away.

saMrOzHCfHb0_Uzdk023JA.text: Wow - this location is quite the hotspot for the business lunch crowd!  There is usually a wait for table - but they do a good job of turning tables over without feeling rushed.    They have a great menu - always something yummy that is seasonal along with great classics.  Burgers, sandwiches, salads, and shareables.  We always get the pretzel bites to start - it comes with a yummy cheese fondue.   Great service, good food.  Just be prepared for a wait during busy times!

e6LThxBQLAeGxuhBbo_yiw.text: Culinary Dropout has such a cool vibe. I bring my friends and family here whenever they visit Tempe because I know there will be good food, drinks, and music.   I recommend the meatloaf. I always order it and then have people steal (multiple) bites off my plate.

1fgvkDxJFWxR8NOP_XJUGQ.text: This place, the space, the staff, and the food are outstanding.   Such a great addition to the Tempe dining scene. Snagged a last-minute Saturday dinner reservation though it was crowded.  Free valet parking a huge help.    Waiter was prompt, charming, and helpful with recommendations.  Food came quickly.  Service couldn't have been better.    We got house salads (delicious and not ordinary), rainbow trout (perfectly cooked and amazing flavor) and green chili stew, whip, as promised by our waiter, made me want to lick the bowl.    Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Green chili stew with cornbread
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rainbow Trout

q40b4SKf9_qMX1JAdnZPQA.text: My first experience visiting and have heard of nothing but good things and a playground for adults! Since this was a lunch hour event I didn't get to partake in the extracurricular activities. At first the menu seemed overwhelming but I kept it simple and had a chicken turkey sandwich. The dropout classic mule had so many flavors of of agave and lime mixed with vodka. I will make sure to make my next visit for happy hour so I can get more playtime !

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dropout classic mule

_e3FNAEnHL7oRa4n_llrcw.text: If you're in a hurry forget it! Slow service doesn't even describe it! Worse than paint drying! Hour and half after ordering still no food! Empty tables everywhere. No excuses.  Seriously skip this place.

RU03Ro0yg0exYVqTHpKLgQ.text: The soft pretzel and provolone cheese fondue is a must get appetizer. Good size, plenty of pretzels for a group of 4. The cheese isn't too sharp or harsh, great complement to the pretzels. The pretzels are almost like rolls, tender and satisfying.   Drink: Deviant Behavior. Fruity and not syrupy sweet, can't taste the alcohol at all, I could easily drink this too fast. They give you the rest of the can of beer... which is great but I wish they would refill the strawberry and lemon too.   I got the prime rib dip sandwich and wasn't thrilled. Good roll, tender meat, but not exciting. Just meat, bread and cheese, good basic sandwich. My sister in law got the fried chicken, I wish I got that. It was crispy and juicy and the honey was a good touch.   Great place for groups but very loud, you'll have to shout to hear each other.

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Must get appetizer. Pretzel with provolone fondue
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shaved prime rib dip

KcYVz3Y9e8oD0NgznFShnw.text: Came here for a work party the other night with 30+ people. It was a hell of a time. Someone from my office pre-planned our entire menu, which was a bummer at first since I wanted to order a bunch of stuff, but they ended up picking a bunch of good stuff so it worked out.   Food:  Pretzel Bread & Cheese Dip - BEST. EVER. I basically filled up on these... Thai Chili Chicken Wings - Best chicken wings I've had tbh House Potatoes & Onion Dip - Needed waaaaaay more dip Turkey Pastrami Sliders - More pretzel bread win but kinda dry. Grilled Cheese Sandwiches - Just okay. Nothing extraordinary. Roasted Garlic Hummus - Also just okay. I got sick of bread at this point.  Drinks:  After School Special - 7/5 - Cocktail AND Beer? Yes.  Velvet Death 5/5 - Gin everything always please. Room Service - 100/5 - I think I ordered 4 of these. So good...  Place had awesome energy and entertainment. I wish we had these or anything even remotely like these in California! Great vibes, foods and drinks. I hope to go back before my trip is over and try out more stuff on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States

r7HpczfoKpA_ZJorJdKjJg.text: I went here with my hubby for a date night. He went here twice before he took me for work meetings. He wanted to take me because he knew I would appreciate their food and vibe.   I was pretty excited about the space. It is super urban and it kind of reminds me of restaurants I would see in Washington DC. So it did remind me of home so I was pretty happy about that. (My hubby knows me so well.) The space itself literally reminds me of an upscale warehouse. It's urban and funky. The vibe is very positive. They have live music on the weekends. So the atmosphere is even more funky just because of that alone.   As far as the food, it's pretty good.   I have to do a side note for those who follow my review and know that I love Korean food. You may wonder why I did not try their kimchi dishes.... I did not try their kimchi options because I grew up on Korean food. So if their Kimchi was not up to standard I would have been instantly disappointed in the place so I opted to go for a no kimchi dish. (Side note: I'm confused why they would do Korean fusion in a place like this... but then again I'm pretty picky about my Korean food... sorry for complaining)   So to avoid instant disappointment from my love of kimchi I opted for their ribs instead. It was pretty good. It was fall of the bone soft and the sauce was layered with flavor.   I also recommend their roasted beet appetizer.   I will digress again... I also saw the cutest party space near their restrooms. This would be the perfect spot for a rehearsal dinner!!

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States

-75BC9x38aLXB5DjgjAIag.text: What a great place with fantastic food. Whoever came up with this concept, good for them because they nailed it.  Waitress Angel was so friendly and accurate. everything we had was great. Korean steak cooked to perfection, apps and drinks were all perfect. Fondue pretzels were the best I've ever had.  Simply amazing

R0gIIHxtN7CXDG8TXM8g9w.text: It is with a heavy heart that I write this review today.  As a chef in the industry, I've always respected the work that Fox Restaurants Concepts have done. Over the years I have frequented most of the restaurants in the valley and have enjoyed the food, service and environment.  There have been several times over the years where if something wasn't right it was always corrected without any issues...great service.  Let's back track to 4 weeks ago, when I ordered the vegan curry.  Good stuff there.  Always delicious.  However, this time when it was placed in front of me, the sweet potato was burnt.  Not just on one side, but on both.  I gave it straight back to my server and told her I wasn't eating that.  She informed me that it was "always cooked that way".  That's funny because I've had that dish at least a dozen time and never once has it come out burnt.  I don't know about anyone else, but I don't enjoy food that's been rendered to ash.  She did remedy the problem, but towards the end of my dining experience I discover the end of the eggplant with the stem on it.  It's never a good experience having to spit out your food in front of guests you invited with a great recommendation. When I pointed out the stem to the server she never said a word about it.  No apology or anything.  However, she did give me the " you're a bitch" look. Thanks for that by the way.  Always lovely in front of guests.    Now, let's move on to two weeks ago.  My family showed up on a Saturday afternoon wanting to enjoy our time together.  By the time we were seated we all decided that the noise level was unbearable and we left.    Now, let's focus on today.  Friday at 11:00 am, my husband and I wanted to enjoy a day together, so we show up at The Yard.  After being seated, the noise level wasn't too bad, because there was hardly anyone there.  The music was louder than normal, but I could still hear my husband and have a conversation with him.  As more and more patrons show up, the noise level became unbearable.  Because the music was so loud, everyone had to talk louder to hear each other. Half way through our lunch I asked our server if the music was normally that loud and she said she'd see if they could turn it down. Of course the level of music wasn't changed, because she could hear just fine and of course didn't see an issue with it.  I have to tell you, I've never been so frustrated with a restaurant experience as I have had today.  Looking around 90% of your clientele are 40 and up, with many in suits having business meetings.  The loud party bar environment you are creating for a weekday lunch experience is outrageous.  I understand the hip culture you are trying to create.  Believe me, I do, but you are alienating your 40 and up clientele, with the party atmosphere.  When we first started patronizing your restaurant, the music was loud enough to enjoy, yet you could also enjoy your conversation.   I think I've had enough frustration with your environment and will leave you all to do what you do, but it's not like my dollar will hurt your business.

mDMm6ZvQbgAAQXq-CIvKNw.text: This was my second adventure at a Culinary Dropout location having previously been to the one in Scottsdale a couple of times. The Tempe location adds a completely different vibe but has the same delicious food and bar drinks. With a large outdoor area filled with bar games, tons of TVs, rooms for having meetings/parties and an indoor/outdoor bar set up its perfect for anyone looking to have a great night out! I don't have a specific favorite item on the menu but every bar snack we ordered was fabulous. Try the fried chicken or the prime rib dip, the pretzel bites, snack boards, heck just order one of everything on the menu. The atmosphere in my opinion is perfect for what I look for in a restaurant. Catering to my need for sports, well made drinks/food and great service Culinary Dropout wherever the location, is my favorite place to go in the Phoenix area.

bioR0ZOjdKW0_FusNfnrig.text: Came here for my farewell lunch back to NJ. Very fun atmosphere, waiters dressed to impress and most of all the food was delicious. Definitely recommend to come here after a long day at work to unwind.

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States

JusPruSkMwKSLwsqN8DY9g.text: We really liked this place. The cocktails were great although the atmosphere may have been a little loud. We sat outside, so it's nice that they have a mister system that's up for the challenge.   We had the antipasti, the best of which was a tie between the beets, deviled eggs, and Korean Brussels sprouts. Overall everyone was happy with their meal.   If you like tequila, they have the Clase Azul Reposado. It isn't cheap, but it goes down smooth!

n6kVgCQBg9lrQYgIcWDmZg.text: Again disappointing! Cannot accept reservations. Been there done that - fill the open tables

AJuVRUqZEBBwWbgHobygQg.text: My family and I loved this place. We didn't have reservations and the estimated wait when we arrived was about an hour and 30 minutes. We didn't have to wait long for seats at the bar and for the table section beside the bar (tall marble-topped tables with stools) to open up. We were perfectly happy to order drinks and appetizers while we waited, but to our delight, we were able to order from the entire menu.   The food!!! We started with the pork belly nachos and these honestly might have been my favorite. Amazing flavor. Our table also ordered the pierogis, which were delicious, and the soft pretzels with cheese sauce, which were lethal & addictive. I ordered the steak salad and loved it. Everyone in my party of 6 gave the food rave reviews.   The service!!! Our waiter was not only attentive and on top of things, but he was so friendly and sweet. We had several other waitresses who would stop by to collect empty plates and check in on our drink refills regularly, and they were just as friendly and sweet. It was such a fun, relaxed, and friendly atmosphere. I would absolutely return if I am ever in the Tempe area again. The only thing I would do differently is perhaps make a reservation to sit at one of their tables or plush-looking booths.

6LQBsqbHXnSkaE5gKNS4aA.text: Visiting from out of town.  Our real estate agent recommended for fried chicken.   We went on a Sunday evening and it was not overly crowded.   Fried chicken was hard to eat because so well done  but at least it was cooked inside.  Burger was quite large and my daughter enjoyed it.   Daughter loved the atmosphere.

mxZOTWa-ZXbjSanbmZU2Fw.text: Been here several times for after work get togethers. Drinks are good and reasonably prized. Food is good for starters or light meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. great drinks.

UUT00-3HmX5mPmawpItHQA.text: Let me say parking was not bad. Finding the place was cool and the scenery is very hipster and laid back. I will say the servers dress casual a lot of trendy outfits and need to say no bras. The server got the pork nachos and my friend got the pretzel with provolone fondue. We shared and it was so yummy. At first I was sad cuz the cheese for the nachos was scarce but the server brought me a big bowl and it made me so happy. Honestly I left completely full and did not spend as much money as the items must have been on happy hour. Overall I ended up very satisfied and full and who doesn't like saving money

Dy3A258cs4tGsecqkMaMWw.text: I absolutely loved this place. Service was excellent as was atmosphere. I was very happy with my turkey pastrami sandwich and we had a variety of appetizers which were all top notch. We went for dinner around 6pm and I'd love to go back to check it out in the evening. It's summer now and no students around. I'm hoping that it retains the same level of quality (atmosphere, service, and food) year-round.

MEnTyrSRVeMMHiIbPkHg2w.text: Happy New Year! Well, it's official - January has flown by and I'm not even sure where time is going!! I hope everyone had a great celebration to ring in the New Year. My husband and I dined at Culinary Dropout on NYE to take advantage of their amazing three course meal.  We went straight into "treat-yo-self" mode when we got there and started off with Korean Style Brussels Sprouts and the Bacon & Parmesan Grissini from their Antipasti menu. My husband found the Brussels Sprouts to be his favorite item the entire night; I was on board with the Grissini which were basically really long breadsticks (not sure how to describe them)!  For our main meal, I went with the Smoked Salmon Toast / Fried Chicken / Apple Crisp. My husband went with Sweet Potato Pierogis / Fried Chicken / S'mores dessert.  It was kind of difficult to pick which of the starters we liked more, both were good in different ways! I actually preferred the Pierogis because the dish was a little bit of sweet & salty but the Smoked Salmon Toast had a good flavor also. Now, my husband and I typically don't get the same entree when we go to a restaurant so we can share but if there's one place to do it, it would be at Culinary Dropout - their fried chicken is always super crunchy and tasty. No regrets on this choice! Both desserts were good but if I had to pick again, I'd go with the S'mores; it was very rich & decadent but amazing. I'm typically not a huge chocolate person but I really enjoyed this dessert!  Overall, a great meal. We did go early in the evening with a reservation so we were seated immediately. They have a nice bar area plus games if you're waiting for your table and have some time. I'll go ahead and keep my rating at 4 stars after multiple visits!

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. S&#39;mores dessert.
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried Chicken.

Iodq0xA5xbCY_O9-Qnp84Q.text: Outstanding from start to finish!  We made reservations at 7:30 PM. Greeted right away by our server Joel. He was GREAT! So friendly & fun.  Wide ranging menu, with lots of options, including Gluten Free. Offered are amped-up pub-type appetizers, salads, sandwiches and entrees!  Atmosphere: Soulful surroundings. Large area for a variety of activities.-Yard Games and Live Music for the whole family too!   In our party of 5 we had : shaved prime rib dip, pub burger, roasted salmon, butternut squash cannelloni & the Korean style ribeye caps.  Presentation on all meals was exquisite...   I do have to say- I was a little bummed, they no longer have the Raviolis. Our server suggested the cannelloni & that it was very similar. Agreed and it's just as delicious. The Ribeye Caps ( prepared medium) was extraordinary... Highly suggest one of these two dishes.   The GM checked in on us many times throughout our visit. Friendly, engaging & professional.   Ended the evening with a deconstructed apple pie & a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream. Yum!  Stellar service, staff & experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salmon Dish
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried Chicken Dish
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sweet Corn Ravioli&#39;s - OMG Divinely Delish!

zd3SRhlR1XHbYMo0z5pw1w.text: This is a nice place to meet friends for the night out to eat drink me play some games the food was good but not amazing but the drinks and staff made up for it, see I still gave 5 stars because I had a great time.

niq4HmNQ_DWTQCwQ_RL4TQ.text: We visited Culinary Dropout during a business trip to Mesa. The atmosphere was fun and low key. Great music, and a fun assortment of drinks (pink Cadillac margaritas and pomegranate mules were good but the green jalapeno margarita was not). The pretzel bites you dip in warm cheese are a must! We also tried the nachos which were good. For dinner, several of us had the steak tacos which were good but super spicy for this spice lightweight. We were far too full for dessert but enjoyed a few fun rounds of ping pong and cornhole to wrap up the evening. Our server was very friendly, offered good advice, and was attentive to our needs. Overall a great, casual night of relaxation.

eH1Mx5nOIFNmGj1pRiNAyA.text: We were visiting from out of town and tried this place based on reviews. OMG. They were right. We loved everything!! The space was so nice and spread out so you aren't eating on top of each other, the bar was really cool and I had this delightful grapefruit cocktail I can't recall the name of but it knocked my socks off in a good way. Then I tried the Cauliflower appetizer and OH EM GEE. I died and went to heaven. Shared the pork belly nachos with a friend and they were so good, but not quite as good as the cauliflower.

06Wjy8Mz-0LW3ObqBRzPWw.text: I truly do love this place. I love the ambience. The food is usually very good! The buildable charcuteries are amazing. The beer selection is always nice.   A very chill place to go with large groups or a cute date. There are plenty of spots for those of you that like photo ops.

oygYOolB9Hly0KZSKzQmPQ.text: First time here and my experience was very good, a lot to choose from..:: from dinner with the family or simply a night out. Live music is always a plus.

nPwCsa9PpUryGDznjfguyA.text: Excellent waiter service. The pretzel and cheese fondue appetizer is very good. Largest Culinary Dropout. Lots of indoor and outdoor seating. Outdoor games like corn hole. If you sign up for their emails, you get $10 off $20 or more.

3dMbJkOSBj6S-TAVqLktOg.text: My family and I came here for my 22nd birthday, and HONESTLY the food was WAY better than I thought it would be. Our bill was over 200$, for 8 people. Which in my eyes is PRICEY, but well worth it. Our waiter reminded us of TV character, and he kinda disappeared for a bit, as well as forgot some of our sides which we had to ask twice for, no big deal. Our food took awhile to come out, and didn't come all at once for the group so we had to wait a bit. Granted is was busy, but still kinda sucked. You would think that such a big place with super hip vibes would have AC inside but alas is does not, doesn't even have fans inside. I recommend trying the sweet corn ravioli or the fried chicken, super bomb. If you have room for dessert I'd recommend the s'more dessert. So good, even though it's obvious it's premade and already starting to separate as you eat it - it's amazing still. I'd recommend coming as a date night rather than a group just because of the price. Overall, amazing experience, pricey bill, and no AC. You would also think with how big their hype is, that their menu would be bigger. There's only one vegan option (a spicy curry), and a few things to choose from. Their menu is based off of a cheese and meat plate which takes up most of the menu, although they do have a wide variety of alcohol. Service could be better.   Update: we made a reservation for 5:30pm, my husband and bestfriend and I got there a little after 5, and we got seated around 5:15p which was nice. But as we got seated, the hostess asked us to be finished by 745pm because they had a reservation for this table at 8pm - which REALLY bothered me. My family and I are here to celebrate, and if we take a little bit we take a little bit, we're paying a HUGE bill to begin with - I feel it was a tad unprofessional to ask us to be finished by a certain time.

c3VFxzjeZcrtmVr0KyExfQ.text: I was in town for work and a group of us decided to try this place. The service was on point with good drinks and I recommend the fried chicken. It was so good! Nice chill spot to relax with friends.

nbxlvAPVQbrYYF7prPOu9g.text: Ok, so my wife and I came here tonight with some of our friends for Restaurant Week.  It really was a tale of 2 different experiences.    My wife ordered the Pretzel and Fondue as an appetizer and it was huge!  And it was deliciousness!  As a dinner course she ordered a Spicy Curry which I tried and we both liked it.  Her dessert course was a Banana Cream Pie which was ridiculously good.  I ordered Hot Wings for an appetizer and it was quite good.  Dinner course I had their house specialty Fried Chicken, I would do it again.  I also ordered the Banana Cream Pie and it to me was the highlight.  Not downplaying the other food that I ordered but it was amazing!    So my wife and I enjoyed our visit and we liked the band playing, although it was loud, it was hard to carry a conversation.    Our friends didn't enjoy themselves at all.  I'm not sure why we had such different experiences.  So I am giving them 4 stars because it wasn't just about us.

p9Ulu4xTD6NG2j0Pzpj0kg.text: This is a great atmosphere if you are looking for good food, friendly service, you can hear yourself talk and want a relaxed eating and drinking experience. I was there for lunch and will be going back and if your a little younger, I bet it turns fun at night.

Xynz3Tks7PuxoqyH5qKjVA.text: I hoped for more.   The pretzel provolone that gets all the raves? Too big. Maybe 15? Of them. Too many for any group less than 4. The cheese was smooth but it needs oomph. It'd be phenomenal as beer cheese given the environs.   We had the chitterlings which the naive young woman serving us pronounced "chit-ter-LINGS". it's not her fault. That's how it's spelled. But these chitlins' were tasty.   He had the turkey pastrami. It had good flavor and a healthy portion.   I had the fried chicken. It's crispy, yes. Even bordering on burned. But it's bland! I wish they'd have served some hot sauce. The mashed potatoes felt too smooth like instant. The biscuit would have been better if warm.   Overall I expected much more since I ordered nearly all house favorites.   I would not go back. There are other options to explore before a return trip.

TFZj7-7n5aqOUbafZtNqSg.text: This was a pleasant surprise. Was in Phoenix for work and we stumbled upon this restaurant. It's inside what looks like a large brick wear-house with some event space and retail shops in the front. Once you get in the restaurant it's very open with a large two sided bar in the center that splits the area in half. I would advise making a reservation as it was totally booked when we arrived at 545pm on a Wednesday. We ended up sitting at the bar which worked out well as we were able to watch some of the basketball games. I had the Ahi Tuna for an appetizer and a steak salad for my main course. The Ahi tuna was different but good and my steak was cooked perfectly. If your in the  Phoenix/Tempe area I would definitely recommend checking this place out.

V1J3gxqU2-9WMXnDGoIdOQ.text: Love the atmosphere.  Great place to go with a large group of friends, girls night out, a date or with my kids.  It's fun and comfortable all year round.  I always get the pinot noir on tap, which is a relatively decent wine and a good price.  It's a Fox Concepts restaurant, so you can count on that consistency of good quality.  Food is fine, though I wouldn't call it a great value or innovative.  Trendy, yes, and better than bar food, and ideal when food is not your main concern.  I am a fan, indeed.

qjNjxi3niqXUT6VpwRJ4RA.text: My wife turned 29, and we went here for her birthday with the family and mind you we have 2 small children. There were no children in there at this time. Mostly professionals and dating couples. We went with another group to celebrate. Service was fast and flawless. Our waiter had a great grasp of the menu. The meatloaf was very tender and I was worried about the ketchup sauce being regular and bland but the flavor was very savory and had some kick to it. The fried chicken is very good and fried to perfection. You can tell they take pride in their fried chicken because the chicken tenders we ordered for the kids were juicy and not overcooked. My mother in law had the fish and chips and she kept raving about how fresh the Cole slaw tasted. There is live music, which can be a bit much if you don't like loud music. But being the blues fan that I am it was a great addition to the meal. We did not have to flag the waiter down at all her was on top of everything for our visit! Great ambience and we will be back! And please get the pretzels and fondue and the monkey bread!

9ySD4Zu93nn7a4-DrNj66g.text: The food is awesome here! Great, friendly atmosphere! If you're looking for a great place to kick back with friends and enjoy the kind of tasty food that makes great company more enjoyable, this place hits the spot, to be sure!

x8o6fW_Yw42aYhP8XNmy-g.text: great food! Thai Chili wings and Fried Chicken were delicious. Do yourself a favor and get the Antipasta.

cQIC1u40iqE85gfHgZn-Vw.text: Food was great & drinks were great too!! The atmosphere was amazing, totally cool. Inside & outside bar with couches & electronic fire pits in the middle. Ping pong tables, corn hole, & shuffle board games in the outside part! So much fun!!

CR0TeZ8rvMF14UM5JDzFRg.text: We have been here twice now.   What I like - service is excellent. Ask to be in Jay's section!  The overall vibe, music, ping pong, corn-hole, TV screens, seating areas & beer selection. An excellent place to hang with friends! Things that could improve - very spendy for the qualify of food, if you sit in the outdoor area this time of the year prepare for your food to arrive a little cold, if going for a football game (they have great TV screens) the visibility on the outdoor screens is a little off in each of the areas.

k3kxq2KKzvUskAaXDL9E9w.text: First time having lunch there.  Week day so good crowd from local businesses. In our party  had two salads and the chicken sandwich. Couple of pale ales as well. Great service ~ fast service. great food!  Will come eat there again when in Tempe!

0vvPXlvW45HFjSp-QyuUKA.text: Where do I begin? I'll start with saying, the night could've been one of the best nights but quickly turned to the worst. All thanks to the bearded, wannabe hippie, JERK of a bartender named Brandon and the unprofessional, rude "manager" of the night, Bryan Carter.   Let me back up, the food was amazing. Probably the best food I've had. Service though...absolutely terrible. We had a freak ping pong accident where a guy in our party cut his head open. The bartender couldn't have been more rude and unprofessional about it. He complained about helping him get a rag, having to clean up a little blood (literally four drops), and gave us nothing but a bad attitude the entire time we were at the bar.   Moving onto the joke of a manager. After the ping pong incident, we were harassed by a fellow customer. After explaining the situation to the "manager", he rolled his eyes and told us there was nothing he could do. Well, there's a lot you could do but you're too lazy to do it.   I'll end my rant now. But just know, I will never be back. No one from our party will be back. Which is quite unfortunate. Because it is a very delicious restaurant but not worth the harassment and disrespect.

SpDkvMrv-RkxFf9Ttj79Fw.text: Omgosh a million times over YES. Such good everything. Great for groups. A little pricey, but.... worth it. I want to live in the kale salad. As well as the pretzels and all the cheeses/meats (even though they can be a bit stingy with some of their portions). New favorite bar in Tempe. Fox Concepts, you guys are so innovative and awesome.

6D198M3pFaRj3wcEU_nrqQ.text: Love their Kale salad.  The pretzels with fondue I rocks!  Great service. Fun energy.  Highly recommend.

K7PFcQxQvlTkjFTkQTDaBw.text: This place is freaking awesome! Totally recommend this to all my friends and people coming in looking for a chill hangout atmosphere! Will definitely return soon! Can't beat $3 happy hour mugs (includes all beers)!! Woot woot!

ds0G5WpdLt5Ij7FfEII8rg.text: Weird location and unique decoration. I felt like I was eating dinner in the cool backyard of a warehouse since we ate outdoors. The theme was very young and hip. Pretty cool hang out place and they had interesting food.

0aEY8RxKlVtLPmayd7HzEg.text: Awesome service, great food that's VERY reasonably priced and a very fun environment! Coming back for sure!

JpW_Ayu0itehgG2KtULN7g.text: This place is amazing! I like it better than the other locations. It has a great vibe, lots of games and an awesome food/drink selection. Would recommend for dinner or late night drinks. Thinking about going there for nye this year!

l92Hz_B6xw2ZN2wf67xFvw.text: Fox Restaurants is part of my portfolio of good eats, however Culinary Dropout in Tempe is not 1 of them. First off; the make up air system for the exhaust grease hoods is waaayyy off, when you enter the building you experience the "wiff" of a back alley Japanese teppanyaki grease fryer-smoke sensation, I had to drop off my clothes at the dry cleaners the next morning to rid this odor. If your not familiar with make up air its the air that is pumped in from the roof to provide the exhaust grease hood to make up for the air its exhausting, sometimes too close to an HVAC unit on the roof it gets pumped in for the patrons to breathe and smell. Second; the layout feels like a junior high school cafeteria with tables lined up in parallel, with all the "cool kids" having fun tossing bags of beans back and forth in the adjoining Yard. Third; our server was pleasant, speedy, but lacked a smile, maybe had a bad day who knows? Fourth; we ordered the "36 hour pork ribs", mistake, they were cold, apx. room temperature or just below, I felt like a cave man chewing the hard to separate meat off the bone, after which we asked where the restrooms were so we could wash our hands from all of the bbq sauce, our server pointed the way down a dreary hallway, why don't they provide a wet nap at minimum, for the $25 plate they should provide a hot towel!   Culinary Dropout is a great matching name for the restaurant, I think every one staffed there may just be Drop Outs...

JzGCFKlp4t25GsB3rdKlbQ.text: Wow.  . . I loved the ambiance of this place. While I am no longer in college, I didn't feel like this was a location that only served collegiate customers, there appeared to be all age groups enjoying the company of everyone.  We sat in the back, pass the bags and ping pong tables and it was a great atmosphere for talking to your group or meeting new people. While the menu is limited here, or it could have been the time (we arrived around 8 p.m.) the food was delicious. I had the Thai wings and several of my peers ordered the cheese and pretzels. The beer selection is pretty decent, for this time of year a lot of the micro brews have holiday selections, I recommend the Sleepy Dog.  Despite the large crowd, the waitress was amazing and attended to our requests with a smile on our face (did I mention we were a large crowd??) I wish I had her name to give her a shout out! But all of the waiters seemed to be really on point. I am hoping this place becomes a regular for my friends, I couldn't be more happy with my experience.

AbvPddQzgARF5_KF8PRkpA.text: This was a fun find. We had time to kill before a flight. The food was both adventurous and delicious. After eating, we went out into the yard and played shuffleboard until we needed to leave. Ping pong tables and cornhole games lent an atmosphere of fun. Will definitely come back.

X6TC17M5yMayAnw7rvMwqg.text: If found this place from a google search, and I absolutely LOVED the experience!  It has a really cool vibe, with a pseudo Mid Century Modern decor, a lively (mainly) 20-30 something clientele.  I was sorry to discover that they were out of the Korean style prime rib (I arrived after 8pm), so I ordred the Bistro Steak and it was FANTASTIC!  I will definitely try to fit this place in my schedule when I visit Phoenix next.

NSQ-LVrujDWX_Sl2Klj6ng.text: Went before the fireworks and it wasn't crowded. The staff really tried to persuade us to sit outside. We had a quirky waiter. Never did bring sweetener for my tea. My date ordered a side salad that came out right away. Then my salad eventually came out & it tasted good.  He ordered a chicken sandwich that must have taken over 30 minutes or longer so we never ate dinner at the same time. Very weird. The GM came to our table since he realized it took so long. Told us dinner was on the house. Then the quirky waiter came back and charged us for my tea that I never got the sweetener for & the salad. I don't plan to return after this first experience. Good luck!

yqVY0dosm3T-AhZa1i08SQ.text: Awesome! This place was great. The food was really good and they had a pretty good happy hour.  If you want to have a good time with a group of friend the dropout is where it's at.

eK1LuYdyjkUpWKlSj8RgYw.text: Went here last night with a group of friends, great place for a large group. We ordered all the top recommend items pretzels, fried chicken, and the salted Carmel dessert. Everything was awesome! The only reason I didn't give this place five stars is because the temp. Inside had to be 85' it was so damn hot!!! We actually left early because it was so hot inside. I was there a month ago and it was hot inside also. Dress cool!

NNoxaCwKibFKXnTqaGwuvQ.text: We visit often. The food is consistent and the patio is a lot of fun. Beware...sometimes they close for a private event, so call ahead if you're using Uber!

_-Ep6lhdSVlBray6Trsjyg.text: Came here on one of the pre-opening nights and the food was fabulous with great service.  Fun vibe, high energy and a great addition to Tempe. Started with antipasti; then we had the rainbow trout and Korean style ribeye cap. Very limited availability so ask for it asap.  Dessert was the bourbon black bottom pie. Yum, yum! We enjoyed plenty of wine and scotch drinks.

aaJsb0T1p05zYAIfbp6wDg.text: Wonderful addition to downtown Tempe. Watched the AZ Cardinals game, they actually play game sound in the back bar. The menu is different from the Camelback location, but still fantastic. There is so much space for large groups and games. Will absolutely be returning - try the Shrimp & Pork Belly Ramen, delicious :)

L5Qm2eXY6F_POhpgAXHjEQ.text: Enjoyed this place. It has a good, hipster type, atmosphere. They have really good food and the drinks were delicious. Our service was also great..I will return!

SyUlEOpql2KEQ7FlzD9RoQ.text: First visit was a weekday lunch. I ordered the kale and sweet corn salad. It was excellent! Everything ordered by the group looked great. Fresh and flavorful.

NLYEr-wflrpkgyJTKCAk6Q.text: If you want to stare at cute college girls, you picked the right place! If you want good food or service, drive to Scottsdale or Las Vegas. 3 attempts and all we experienced was long waits, cold food, and bad service. As someone who loves the fox franchise, it's sad that their name is on this location.

0PmpE5Y_cOfyZ59sLjwawg.text: Fun environment, great fun service. Fabulous ribs and fried chicken. Flexible host stand and friendly staff throughout.

iGvyR1vJJ8doWJvAlt_0iQ.text: DO NOT VALET your car here and maybe not even park at all since apparently they are having a "security" issue with the parking lot...this was the valet service Manager's response after filing an incident report on Tuesday regarding the VERY large, deep scratch on my barely had even a week, new vehicle, which was entrusted in their care; not that I really had an option, because they have two areas for valet service and rope off access to the bigger parking lot..almost forced to valet, so they can damage your vehicle, in which they are not responsible for unless the valet driver is actually driving the vehicle at the time, in which they have no ability to prove if the driver was driving or not..so your screwed regardless! I'll be sure to tell everyone I know, too!

W2XyblN60HHQoc79v0WgeQ.text: Have been to Culinary Dropout/ The yard a few times and haven't had a bad experience yet. The staff are friendly and attentive and the food/drinks are good. Nice atmosphere and pretty cool that you can play cornhole and table tennis etc. My brother and my best friend were in town from Australia and raved about the pretzel bites!

Kvo02EZWk5tE8gizBebBmQ.text: Not so much.  They really don't like regulars.  It's expensive for a beer, and the food is just ok.  Many more places in Tempe will treat you better than here.  Numerous occasions bringing friends here and waiting way too long for a table when plenty were empty.  Hostess just forgot about us.

zkSvM2NZb47dNKwMMn-5hQ.text: Trendy and overpriced.  The staff, and overall look of the furniture and fixtures make this a very hipster hangout restaurant.  I tried the Korean Style Ribeye Cap which was touted as one of their signature dishes.  I expected something marbled with fat and as tasteful as a cut of wagyu beef and I was sorely disappointed.  It was not that much meat and didn't come with any sides.  I had to add a desert just to fill me up.

HnuTq4XIp5BTdZMz3n44Cg.text: Came here with a large group of co workers on Friday evening. I had very mixed feelings about this place. The pros were definitely the large space (great for events!), easy convenient free parking, tasty drinks, and nice outdoor concept area with games and couches. The cons were the heat and humidity that made sitting in the outdoor area uncomfortable (everyone was soaked in sweat), overpriced food and drinks, and surly staff. My co worker had a dog and was rudely informed by 6 different staff members that dogs weren't allowed. I get it, but you can be a little nicer about it. Not necessary for 6 people to give her a hard time. She ended up leaving immediately because she couldn't stay with the dog. The drinks were very expensive- $10 to $12 for their underwhelming and small cocktails. Tasty but expensive. I had some sangria and it was $8 a glass and delicious but weak. Also very small especially considering how much ice was in the cup. The service was surly and there was a lot of pressure to keep ordering more and more. It was clear that they do not want you to hang out on the couches unless you are quickly and consistently spending lots of money. Again I get it but you can make it a little less known. I would definitely come back but I would manage your expectations with this place. Know what you're getting into. This is not your friendly neighborhood bar.

Gso4AFAz69dKxiVekLFcgA.text: They have great happy hour deals for food and drinks especially the pretzels and cheese and the sangrias! Plenty of seating indoors. Really fun, hip atmosphere for all ages. Backyard games, like cornhole, to play outside with fans and misters, but it was still too hot for me to even want to outside, so I didn't really check it out. I only looked from the window. The only qualm I have is the small parking lot. They do have complimentary valet.

kdlB5XWebrC64egdOuBjyQ.text: Came in late for dinner while on a business trip. Fun vibe, good service, good beer and a tasty seared ahi salad.

TW5d2jUsZYUdFLsI-ys43w.text: Good food, great service, and an awesome atmosphere!  This place is a must for anyone visiting and looking for a good place to socialize, eat, and drink.

nvO0XIX77jfoP_nketriyA.text: Great environment, casual open yet current vibe with good choices of Moscow mules and charcuterie choices. Had the jalapeno and molasses ribs that were delicious. Request wipes as this will get messy. The Korean style ribeye was ok and meat portion was smaller than expected but vegetable accompaniment was flavorful. Overall fun and good place to try

rJu6wY5mkbBSgobu_5rfKw.text: Fun games and atmosphere. Very hip and trendy. But the food seriously sucks. I've had the smoked salmon, pretzels and cheese dip, and grilled cheese sliders. Just extremely unimpressed for the price. If you go go for the drinks and games not the food.

29Srw_-KTsaz9N_eSYUxSA.text: Absolute blast!!! Try the pretzel bites with fondue, they're amazing. Also their burgers are great. Drinks are a little pricey, but great. Also, they have games(ping pong, corn hole, etc.) Definitely a fun hangout with friends.

2BUK6OyjqiUWERLFZUaw2Q.text: They have the best pretzel bites out of any restaurant that I've ever been too. The aroma of the restaurant is very nice and comfortable they have something for everyone there

AHQUmKC2rTd-I_2u5r5pYg.text: You want a place that has incredible food and swanky ambiance and yet somehow manages to be casual at the same time....choose culinary dropout.  We went here for a team meeting and all the food was indeed a culinary delight.   They were thoughtful and accommodating for our one gluten free coworker.  They run out of the Korean steak, but when we called ahead they made sure our table had 6 scrumptious perfectly cooked steaks.  I've been to several culinary dropouts, but this location is my favorite due to the structure and entire feel of the complex.

580hiIWFdcwm2X9yZGfiNQ.text: Excellent food and service. Great atmosphere and haven't been disappointed by anything. Pork belly nachos are the best! They are a must try. Love the weekly beer choices.

AoAHwoNj933SaJlyzp3j1w.text: I was super excited to go here with my brother for his birthday dinner after seeing all the great reviews but we both were deeply disappointed. The aesthetic of the place was really cool and laid back. But the food was overpriced and not tasty at all. We shared the pork belly nachos which seemed like velveta cheese melted on chips with barely any toppings other than that. My brother got the fish and chips which came with flimsy fries and I got the tacos which was 17$ for 3 tiny tacos that in my opinion weren't that good. If you want a casual place to drink go for it but as far as food goes don't waste your money.

b0PVs0HwQPoGA1I5zdPSmA.text: Monroe our server was the best. So kind and funny. Great atmosphere, good food, my egg sandwich was to die for.

vDr1PGAEWgrnI_eEE3tZ6w.text: Amazing service with a waiter who explained the whole menu to us. The cocktails were amazing (especially the pomegranate mule) delicious cider and beer on tap. The 36 hr ribs are a MUST they were so tender, falling off the bone and had the best marinade. The chopped chicken salad was also fresh delicious and filling. Would definitely return!l

ZMqNam73nIhn5bSL45RUCw.text: It was alright, it's was my third time here. I wanted to go up to the bar to get my drink insteady of waiting for my server. I had already ordered a drink with my server, and I went up to the bartender, ordered the same drink, and showed my ID. he laughs in my face and gives it back and says "I can't take this." I asked why and he just laughed. I handed it again and asked "are you sure? can you tell me why my ID is not acceptable?" he took my ID, looked at it again, and showed the other bartender and laughed. the other bartender looked confused but laughed along. he was about to hand it back and said "seriously, i'm not gonna take this." i was about to get up and just go wait for my server at my table cause this guy was being super weird. he looked at it one more time and was like "ohhhh, i'm so sorry, here's the drink on me!"   ????? it was so awkward and unnecessary and embarrassing for me.  anyways, the food was meh like always and the place just always fails to excite me but it's somewhat a fun atmosphere and most of the workers are nice and there's free valet so 3 stars.

_lu0b5PaVj23Z2l5YfhGqQ.text: Every time I go to Culinary Dropout I am always pleased with the service and food. The only issue I have is that their happy hour ends so early around 5pm. I get off of work at 3:30pm which is pretty early and still find it hard to make it on time for their happy hour along with traffic and etc. I've always wanted to try the brunch too but they always end it so early around 10:30ish I believe. If you sit near the walls you get no phone service which isn't a huge deal. Food and service great but the time cut offs for happy hour and brunch not so great.

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried Chicken
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chip &amp; Onion Dip

Zv8BrKi8E2jI1fNGOkbssw.text: Overpriced burgers and sandwiches.  They even call their burger the MAC burger but it costs three or more times more than Mac to pay for their 'capital' cost!  It was tasty - yum calories...

hmhtprYePkWPeFVPaNhRRA.text: Very enjoyable meal!  Fresh made food was amazing. The BBQ pork belly nachos are described by my son as "salty cheesy and delicious". The pork belly was tender moist. My English husband had the fish and chips were good. Batter crisp fish was moist and flakey cooked to perfection and even the fries and slaw were tasty. When the Englishman gives fish and chips a thumbs up, it is definitely worth ordering. I enjoyed the pub burger without the bun. The aroma was amazing the minute it was in front of me. We will be back the next time we visit Arizona.

W74kgPBwHCToWI3Kus4khw.text: Can't wait to go back here! Awesome service, fantastically comfortable dining area, super cool restaurant concept. After reading several Yelp reviews, two of us shared the ribs, but first we tried the deviled eggs, Brussels sprouts, and strawberries with Brie. All delicious. The Brie was whipped perhaps? It had the consistency of whipped cream, but definitely tasted like a good mild Brie. We substituted salad for fries as the ribs' side order, and without asking they plated the ribs split for us, including splitting the salad and excellent Cole slaw. We were going to skip dessert, but our great server made it too easy to fall for the Monkey Bread. Yummy! We could have spent hours here, but our layover was too short.

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Prosciutto Deviled Eggs, Korean Style Brussels Sprouts, Strawberry, Pistachio &amp; Brie
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Very busy kitchen

cB93B2CEgB6_wevzsYuOcg.text: Even though it was a busy game day we were sat right away. This place is quite large so there are many seating areas indoor and outdoor. Thankfully there were televisions scattered about so we could watch the early game while grabbing a late lunch.  We started with the Soft Pretzels & Provolone Fondue. This was a nice way to start the meal. You get quite a lot so it is a great appetizer to share for a large table. The pretzels are good, but its the provolone fondue that makes this really good. It was creamy and tasty.  For my meal I ordered the Turkey Pastrami. It comes on a pretzel roll and is topped with swiss and coleslaw. It was a hearty and tasty sandwich. It certainly will fill you up. The different flavors and textures come together nicely. I am a big fan of slaw on sandwiches so it was good out of the gate for me.  We did not take advantage of it but there is a large area for games like cornhole and shuffleboard. It certainly would make for a fun night with friends over drinks.

ED6_30YvOZwWxpuF3hzkpA.text: Excellent cheese board selections, great salads! Great atmosphere. Highly recommended!

ZOIKbLbz4Q8k30yceTb5iA.text: Trendy atmosphere and huge restaurant. The burgers are really to die for. Good for groups, and families or a date. They have some local beer options and full bar, I tried a hazy IPA, my fave. I would definitely come again.

dulQUgOp_5BEePudlbKPpQ.text: Went here for the first time today and really enjoyed it. Really cool location and decor, great atmosphere. Servers were friendly and we were seated immediately. Food took a little bit but not too long. It was all so good! The sandwich I had was really good, and there weren't any problems! Overall a great place I'd bring my husband back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken club sandwich, great!
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great vibe and atmosphere

8eOoopbjKgdEAF24YJPUMQ.text: What a fun, quirky, comfortable space! I love the mismatched seating and the industrial touches. The onion dip and chips were tasty and I had the chicken sandwich. The bacon was a bit smoky for my tastes, but it worked with the sandwich. I didn't take a lot of pictures,  but I did take one of my drink. Beer snobs might stick up their noses, but this girl, me, likes a non-beery beer.  It tasted like strawberry lemonade! I would go back just for the Deviant Behavior. It was a great first stop on my first day in Arizona.

photos.caption: Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Culinary Dropout - Tempe, AZ, United States. Deviant Behavior - yes please!

LhZXSoDgJFWvyi3nbsa2uA.text: I love this place and so wish we had one in Reno.  I'm a frequent traveler to Tempe and have been here a number of times, always in groups of 10 or more.  Every time the service is on point and we are well taken care of.  The food is always delicious and we leave happy and feeling good.  We have had private events here in their dining rooms which was an awesome experience.  They served a preset menu with everything being shared. It was fantastic. Most recently we dined in the regular area but in a large group, also with a preset menu to order from.  We have a lot of Keto folks currently and even though we had a menu, they accommodated a number of special requests like pros, including substituting fresh veggies in to dip in the cheese sauce.  There was literally not one complaint in the group.   They keep the drinks flowing. And while a couple were mixed up, they fixed immediately.  The best part is that after dinner you can play some table tennis or corn hole.  Our group loves to be competitive so this is a great way to end the evening.will definitely keep coming back here for sure.

aXSFEAdgg-TzoGDvnJqTrQ.text: We arrived here at 6:45pm on a Thursday evening.  Luckily, we had made 7:00pm reservations or we would have had to wait 45 minutes.  While we were waiting, we loved watching the kitchen prep through the large windows.  We were seated promptly at 7:00pm.    This place is pretty loud (the outside is noisier than the inside), but we got a seat in an area that wasn't too bad (opposite side from the hostess desk).    Our server was nice and highly efficient.    We ordered the fried chicken dinner and the steak salad so we could split the two.  The salad was very good with the best blue cheese dressing that I've ever tasted.  The fried chicken came with 3 pieces: breast, thigh and leg.  We typically prefer dark meat, but the chicken breast was the tenderest we've ever had.  The chicken had good crunch and was nicely seasoned.  The mashed potatoes were good with an onion gravy.  The Cole slaw was very nice, on the sweet side.  My husband didn't care for the biscuit, but I liked it.  It seemed like a cross between a corn bread and a biscuit.    The food came out in about 15-20 minutes.  Not bad.    They have free valet parking so it will only cost you a tip.  The guys were super nice.  Other than the noise level, this is a very good spot for dinner.

qSTvoKL5DrSO1BBD0Vd3_Q.text: 3/16/2019 Yelp Review Culinary Dropout Tempe, AZ The Yard at Farmer Arts District 149 S Farmer (480) 240-1601        Since coming to Arizona for college, Culinary Dropout has been my favorite restaurant by far for several reasons. Whether I am with my boyfriend, my family, or a large group of friends and family for a birthday dinner, Culinary Dropout is a go-to restaurant for any occasion. I have only positive things to say about Culinary Dropout as it has significantly exceeded my expectations in a restaurant.         To start, my roommate and I had a joint birthday dinner on March 19th at Culinary Dropout. We invited a group of about ten friends, and both of our parents came since they were in town for the weekend. Culinary Dropout is located inside the Yard at Farmer Arts District, and we were seated in the outside patio area of the restaurant. The outdoor area of the restaurant is very spacious, and guests are able to claim the couches and chairs for their parties without a reservation. My dad and grandpa went to the restaurant earlier in the evening in order to claim a couch in the outdoor area to accommodate our large party. The ambiance of Culinary Dropout is unlike any other restaurant. For instance, guests are able to play cornhole, foosball, ping-pong, and shuffleboard in the outdoor area as well while they wait for their food or their table. Further, the restaurant atmosphere is hip, lively, and loud. The inside area of the restaurant looks very similar to a gastropub and even has a small stage that cover bands perform live at on weekends. The outdoor area of the restaurant feels like a college bar on Mill, including two bars, large couches, several large TV's playing sports games, and an area for guests to play games. Unfortunately, the downside of choosing to eat at Culinary Dropout is that the restaurant always has significantly long wait times, so a reservation for any party size is a must.         At the birthday dinner, our group ordered the Soft Pretzels with Provolone Fondue as an appetizer, and it is one of the best items on Culinary Dropout's menu. When the appetizer was served, the soft pretzels were warm, and the provolone fondue was perfectly melted. This appetizer always gets eaten in a very short amount of time because it is very delicious and not too heavy. The menu is not very extensive, but it offers a wide variety of foods and drinks. Most importantly, Culinary Dropout offers options on their menu for people with dietary restrictions and allergies. Whenever I eat at this restaurant, I try to order something different every time because their food is phenomenal. At the birthday dinner last Saturday, several of the girls and I ordered the Beer Battered Fish & Chips which is one of Culinary Dropout's most popular dishes. This was the first time I ordered fish and chips from Culinary Dropout and it was probably the best fish and chips dish that I have ever eaten. The beer battered fish was perfectly cooked, and the fries were very delicious, crispy, and lightly salted.         The pricing of the food and drinks on the menu are considered to be overpriced for some; but in my opinion, the pricing is very fair because the food is exceptional compared to other restaurants. The fish and chips dish that I ordered at the birthday dinner was $16.50 which I believe is a fair price point because the dish was relatively large and I was able to take a lot of it home for leftovers.         The service at Culinary Dropout is incredible. The waiter that served us was very patient with us and was very friendly. The waiter suggested several dishes and appetizers for us to consider ordering. I was really appreciative that our waiter did not hover over us because our group was not in any rush to leave and we were enjoying our time there. Our appetizer and entrees were both served to us faster than expected even though we had a large party. Our waiter also brought out two monkey bread desserts for both my roommate and me with candles on them so that our group could sing Happy Birthday to us which was super sweet. I am always impressed by the friendliness of the waiters at Culinary Dropout, and I believe this restaurant has great service.         Overall, I gave Culinary Dropout five stars out of five because of the fun atmosphere, phenomenal food and drinks, fair price points, and excellent service. I recommend Culinary Dropout to anyone who is looking for a fun restaurant with great food in the Tempe area! Just be sure to make a reservation in advance to avoid long wait times. [775 words]

2FYZO2U0TN5_1-pOHkphOQ.text: Everyone working was extremely friendly and positive. I enjoyed the vibe and decor as well. I will be back to try other things.   Egg Sandwich- I LOATHE those who fail to melt the damn cheese on an egg sandwich. Seriously, it made the experience go downhill fast. QN8-c5rfpXY1l0S_YiEF0A.text: You cannot go wrong with a Fox Concepts restaurant. At least this has been my experience so far. I met a client here for lunch. The location is HUGE, lots of meeting space and lots of seating.  Side note: when I walked in a guy was looking for his credit cards he lost the night before, he said he had "too much fun" there the night before...lol. I hope he found them.  Anyhow...you can make a reservation here and probably should. It does get busy. I had the salmon - amazing. My client had the meatlof - loved it. We shared the pretzel bites with cheese. OH EHM GEE. I wish I lived in Arizona so I could eat those more often. Those plus apple cider beer would just be heaven.  Ok maybe it's good I don't live in Arizona so I can't eat those all the time. Probably not good for the gut...  In any case, this place is a gem. Definitely check it out. It will suit all food preferences and your foodie friends too.
